intro: Occultia ledebourioides, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, succulent growth form and fleshy, spiny leaves that help it conserve water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming during the rainy season. Its adaptations to harsh environments include deep root systems and a slow growth rate. Occultia ledebourioides is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
